name: Michael Reeve
description: Michael Reeve is a current junior at The University of Maryland studying Computer Science
about: I am a rising senior Computer Science student at the University of Maryland and a current software engineer intern at Teradyne. My skills include CI/CD workflows and backend development. I am constantly seeking opportunities to expand my knowledge and grow my skill set in the field.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
description: Added debugging capabilities to a Visual Basic interpreter in C#
Developed a VSCode Extension to connect to the VB Debugger via the Debug Adapter Protocol

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
description: Implemented a CI/CD pipeline for a team of over 20 members
Improved our team's build times by 250% by implementing an automatic workflow that only recompiled necessary files
Leveraged the use of webhooks, allowing the pipeline to automatically start a build when a team member made a commit to the codebase
Developed using Jenkins and Docker images as agents, with support for Gitea

projects.title: Personal Website
description: Created a statically rendered portfolio website using Astro, and Tailwind CSS.
Took advantage of Astro's component-based structure to layout my portfolio in a consistent and easy to edit manner.
Hosted on Netlify, using GitHub Actions as a CI/CD pipeline to automate building, testing, and distribution of the website via the Netlify CLI.

projects.title: Slack Tasks Bot
description: A Slack bot written in JavaScript to manage tasks in a Slack workplace, leveraging the Slack Bolt API.
Supports assigning members to tasks, and sending messages to members asking to take on tasks.
Uses SQLite as a backend database.

projects.title: Restaurant Review Website
description: A full stack application to view and review restaurants in College Park, MD, written in Python using Flask.
Implements secure user management with CSRF safe forms, and hashed passwords.
Uses MongoDB as a backend database.

projects.title: Twitter Data Analysis and Sentiment
description: Analyzed Elon Musk's Twitter activity throughout 2022 and drew conclusions based on ML sentiment algorithms.
Gathered data from Kaggle and Twitter API.
Used Python and Pandas to compile csvs and compute statistical equations.
